fields.description:
Create a policy wizard for initial policy creation.

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Add+Access+Policy

comments.body: condition keys supported by Euca (do not implement those that are not implemented in Euca services). Please see [~sjones] for help when implementing this if you get confused about what's supported.

[~jloza]: Looking at the AWS API docs at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/iam-policies-for-amazon-ec2.html , the following don't appear to be supported as resource type choices…

- VM type
- Availability zone
- IP address or range

The are, however, supported in the conditions.  So the wireframe needs to be updated to list the following in the resource selector…

- Instance
- Image
- Security group
- Key pair
- Volume
- Snapshot

Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/208 was merged into develop just now.  Although the Add Policy page isn't fully implemented (missing conditions), I'm submitting what we have so far for UX review since it's a fairly massive effort.

Implementation Notes:
- "VM type", "IP address or range", and "Availability zone" were removed to be consistent with the possible resource type choices per AWS docs, as they apply to conditions per se.
- Moving the "All [resources]" choice into the input rather than in an expando significantly simplifies the code base. Let's discuss, [~jloza]
- Actions that don't pertain to a resource type will not display the add resource option. Only the "Add conditions" will display. May need to update the wireframe to better handle this case.
- The file upload handler reads the file and places the text into the policy text area.  JSON validation will be implemented later.
- The "Add conditions" feature will be implemented later

@kamal, you said : "VM type", "IP address or range", and "Availability zone" were removed to be consistent with the possible resource type choices per AWS docs, as they apply to conditions per se." All specific resource choices (other than specifying an ARN) are *euca-specific API extensions*, and those are definitely there. There is a link to the doc explaining these in the wireframe, and the wireframe notes these should only be implemented for Euca EC2 operations. When we support AWS, and AWS conditions support all the specificity our users need, we can get rid of this euca-specific stuff, but for now, it's needed. 

The wireframe already mentions all the resource/condition stuff, you may have to scroll all the way over to the right to see everything.
[~kgill], we need a way to undo clicking a check or X. If they click it again, it should toggle off and remove that statement from the policy. Is that possible?

[~jloza]: Ah, will reinstate the vm type, ip address and avail zone options in the resource type selector.  
Guess I was too absorbed in the AWS docs and forgot about the Euca-specific extensions noted in the wireframe.

AWESOME so far!

Kicking back for remainder of work. One additional thing to note that we discussed on the phone, but just to keep track: Conditions are associated with resources and not orthogonal, so they need to be inside the resource button...

[~kgill], noticed in the demo today that we are not validating for properly formed policy names. Please be sure we do that before sending the request to the CLC. Thanks!

[~jloza] Question regarding conditions in a policy statement...

The AWS docs at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/PolicyVariables.html seem to indicate that resources and conditions have a sibling rather than parent-child relationship, which may require a redesign of the UX since the wireframe assumes conditions are scoped within a resource.  Could we confirm the relationship between conditions and resources in a policy statement?
Thanks for catching this! This stuff is super confusing. After phone chatting, wireframe has been updated. :)

Capturing notes from an IRC chat…

The condition keys are documented at
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/iam-policies-for-amazon-ec2.html#amazon-ec2-keys

Eucalyptus adds an "ec2:TargetImage" condition key to the list.

[~jloza]: I'm looking at implementing the context-specific widgets for the conditions, and I need to know what condition value widgets are appropriate for each of the condition key/operator combinations.  

Looking at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/iam-policies-for-amazon-ec2.html#ec2-supported-iam-actions-resources , there's a ton of restrictions on what condition keys are appropriate for each action, but it doesn't specify what values are appropriate for each condition key/operator combination.

For example, what key/operator combination should be selected to display the instance picker?
hi [~kgill], let's sync up tomorrow and go over each one. I'll put together a list first. :)

[~jloza] Also, should add the S3-specific condition keys for the S3/Walrus actions in the policy generator?  The relevant AWS docs are at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingIAMPolicies.html
[~kgill] yes there are conditions for other services besides EC2. Do you need something from me here? Let me know!

Hey Jenny,

I haven't been able to work on the remaining issues w.r.t. the Add Policy page since I've been slammed with security-related and packaging-related blockers, among other bug fixes.

Here are the known remaining issues.  IMO they shouldn't hold up moving the policy wizard to QA, but that's your call…
- Need a date picker widget for date/time conditions.  Maybe we should open a separate "improvement" ticket for that?
- Condition keys for S3/Walrus are poorly documented by AWS.  Please advise on the priority of getting those in for 4.0, and maybe we can open a separate ticket for that work?

[~kgill] date widget isn't really an improvement. It's the widget we need. So, if you want to pass this to QA so they can start testing it, I think that's a good idea, can you please open bugs (not improvements) for the remaining items and link them to this ticket, and then I can UX review this one and move it on to start getting QA eyeballs on it, I am cool with that...
[~jloza] will open bugs for the remaining items, thanks!
[~kgill] awesome thanks! Be sure you link them to this ticket too, so we can keep track of progress toward completion of the feature as a whole. YAY
[~jloza] Opened https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-583 to track the date picker widget
[~kgill] please let me know if you've also opened a ticket for the s3 condition keys and then I can move this to QA.
[~jloza] The ticket for the S3 condition keys is GUI-584 (linked in the "relates to" list above)

[~kgill] thanks! I'm moving this to QA. However, I noticed there's no default name implemented for the policy, and we need to do that The user shouldn't have to enter one, but they can change the one we put in there. I'll file a separate ticket for that. Thanks!
[~jloza] Hold off on QA'ing this, since we may need to modify the policy page to troubleshoot GUI-637, which I'm working on today.

looks great on QA machine!

verification done on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 27.0.1
[~kgill] missed your note, if you find make any changes let me know and I will re-QA.
